tt.desc1: Use your skills, try to turn a profit!
tt.desc2: Cannot spend money when you have a negative balance
tt.desc3: Bankrupt and game over if you have negative balance for 48 hours
tt.desc4: Must begin on a Medium size map
tt.desc7: Can continue spending, even with negative balance
tt.desc8: Game never ends due to bankruptcy

tt0.desc0: When playing in Career Mode you will start on a {0} map ({1}x{2}). You can expand and purchase more land, to accommodate your ever-growing airport!

tt1.desc0: When playing in Sandbox Mode, you may choose which size map you want to start with. You can still purchase additional Land to expand later, too, but this determines your starting map size. Note that property taxes are a bit higher on larger plots of land!

tt.desc: Starting from scratch will begin with an empty plot of land but requires more time to get your airport up & running. If you're a new player, we recommend leaving this off to get started playing SimAirport right away with our built-in starter airport layout.
These will give your airport additional resources and helpful goals to work towards. Disabling grants unlocks all of the rewards for it immediately.

save.title: Save Game

step1.title: Saving...
step1.desc: Just a moment while we save your game...

step2.title: Saved!
step2.desc: Your game has been saved successfully.

save.edgeBranchNotice: As a precautionary measure, file overwrite is prohibited on Edge releases of SimAirport. Please choose a unique name each time you save your game.
save.search: Displaying {0} of {1} saved games that match "{2}". To view all existing save files, clear the filename in the input field above.

delete.title: Delete File
delete.desc:
CAUTION!
This will permanently delete the selected game from your computer. Are you SURE you want to delete this save?

gameplay.title: Gameplay
gameplay.language2: For best results, please restart SimAirport after changing language.

hotkeys.title: Hotkey Bindings
hotkeys.waitingbody: Press any key to assign it to function:

steam.title: Upload & Share on Steam Workshop
steam.name: Name
steam.e_inprog: Another upload is already in progress.
steam.e_exception: Something went wrong... Please let the devs know!
steam.desc0: Please wait while we save your game, upload it to Steam, and Publish it on the SimAirport Workshop!
steam.desc2: Please wait while process & upload your mod to Steam -- and Publish it on the SimAirport Workshop!
steam.desc3: Your item is now published to the workshop.

tt.title: Terms of Service
tt.desc0: You MUST click through and accept the the Terms of Service for the Steam Workshop before you will be able to share your saves publicly!

steam.help: Please ensure that the Steam Client is open and that you are logged in. Login and restart the Steam Client and SimAirport, then try again.
steam.thirtyseconds: Sorry, something went wrong. Try restarting both the Steam Client and the game, then try again.

tt0.title: Unauthorized
tt0.desc0: You may only update or publish mods that you are the original owner/author of.

tt1.desc0: This mod requires other mods (custom Aircraft) to function properly. Those other mods that it requires MUST be uploaded to Steam before this mod can be uploaded.
tt1.desc1: This mod requires custom art before it can be uploaded to the Steam Workshop.
tt1.desc2: Mods can only be uploaded to the Steam Workshop if they contain customized art.

tt2.title: Cannot Demo Spawn
tt2.desc0: This feature requires using the "Mod Test Map" (see left panel to load it). The demo must take place on a suitable & functional gate in an airport without any passengers or other aircraft.

mods.tt3: Create a new Aircraft mod, which allows you to create an entirely new Type of aircraft. You can then include this Aircraft in any of your custom Airline fleets & share it on the Steam Workshop.
mods.tt4: Refresh the listing of available Aircraft mods found on your computer.
mods.tt5: Opens the mod folder location in your computer's file browser program.
mods.tt6: Create a new Airline mod using the default templates; you can then edit the settings and graphics using 3rd party programs.
mods.tt7: Refresh the above listing of available Airline mods found on your computer.

research.title: Research & Development
research.edgeNote: SimAirport Edge Build Only: Right-click for instant research.

tt.desc2: Click to view additional details about {0}

tt.title: {0} {1} Offers
tt.desc2: Immediately collects the signing bonus and allows these offers to be added to your master flight schedule.
tt.desc4: Your airport does not yet meet the requirements for the aircraft types.
tt.desc5: You must build an ATC Tower to accommodate more than 10 flights per day.
tt.desc6: Requires at least one Runway to be upgraded with lights.
tt.desc7: Requires a Runway at least {0} in length.

tt.title: Edit Columns
tt.desc1: Click here to change which columns are shown or hidden. Use the resize handle (bottom right) to resize the window.

tt.title: Edit Columns
tt.desc1: Click here to change which columns are shown or hidden. Use the resize handle (bottom right) to resize the window.

loans.title: Bank Loans
loans.status: Loan Status Outstanding Principle> Daily Interest Effective Interest Rate

applyBtn.txt1: Loan availability & rates subject to credit approval.

repayBtn.txt1: Pay money back to decrease principle balance.

loans.description:
You may borrow money from the bank and the bank will charge you interest each day.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Only the interest payments are deducted automatically each day. You can repay the loan principal from this interface.

pl.title: Profit & Loss
pl.tt: Click to expand or collapse details...

valuation.title: Airport Value
valuation.tt_desc0: Selling your airport allows you to start over with a higher initial balance and retain your current Research progression.
valuation.tt_desc1: Note: You can still continue running this airport from the most recent save.
valuation.requirements0: Run airport for at least {0} days

credit.title: Credit Report
credit.tooltip: More accurate rate estimates can be unlocked via researching Credit Reporting

pricing.title: Commercial Pricing
pricing.intro: Set the prices that airlines must pay you. Be careful -- some airlines are more cost-sensitive than other airlines; airlines may decide not to work with you if your prices are too expensive or your airport services can't justify the costs!
pricing.rwyusage: Runway Usage Income How much you charge airlines to use your runways, per usage.
pricing.terminalusage: Terminal Usage Income How much you charge airlines to use your terminal, per passenger.
pricing.btnsaveerror: Recently Edited! You must wait 12 hours to change again!
pricing.btnsavewarning: Raising price may cause airlines to be less interested in your airport. They may even terminate their contract with you which costs you money!! Note: You may only edit prices once every 12 hours!

runways.title: Runways
runways.restriction_arrival: Allow or disallow arrivals (landings) for this runway
runways.restriction_departure: Allow or disallow departures (takeoffs) for this runway
runways.restriction_common: Be careful -- flights will cancel if they do not have a runway available that can access their gate!

fuel.title: Fuel Services
fuel.desc1: Refueling services will not be offered to airlines.
fuel.desc3: If prices stay the same, about {0} of {1} flight(s) will request fuel.
fuel.desc4: This will require approximately {0} - {1} liters of fuel.
fuel.desc8: Refueling services will not be offered to airlines.
fuel.desc9: Fuel will be sold to airlines at a rate proportional to the fluctuating market price. Demand for refueling services will remain relatively stable, but profit margin will fluctuate.
fuel.desc10: Fuel will be sold to airlines at a specified price, regardless of the current market rate. Demand for refueling services will fluctuate accordingly, but profit margin will remain stable.

tt_opstatus.title: Operational Status
tt_opstatus.desc4: At least 1 hangar with a fuel truck
tt_opstatus.desc5: A Fuel Depot that meets requirements
tt_opstatus.desc6: Demand for refueling services will vary by airline, aircraft type, and price sensitivity.

tt_recurring.title: Requires initial infrastructure
tt_recurring.desc1: Recurring orders can only be placed after having built fuel storage tanks.

tt_hud.title: The Fuel Exchange
tt_hud.desc1: Fuel market prices at a glance. You can optionally disable this top HUD panel from the Fuel area of the Ops Control Panel.

maintenance.title: Maintenance
maintenance.info_blurb: Maintenance is allowed during the daily "maintenance window" specified above. Objects at or below their maintenance thresholds will be repaired. While undergoing repair, objects are temporarily out of service for use. Regular maintenance is most cost effective, but hinders airport operations!
maintenance.repairsubheading: Customize maintenence handling for each object type.
maintenance.repairbody:
Choose one of the following three approaches for your workers to use when deciding how and when to conduct maintenance and repairs in your airport.
Only During Window Start repairs on an object only during the window and stop repairing the objects immediately when the window ends. You may still manually override the window for any given individual object.
Always Finish Once a repair begins on an object, the workers will ALWAYS finish it compltely -- even if the maintenance window ends, they will continue repairing until the object is completely finished.
Any Time Ignores the window entirely. Workers will begin repairs [i]any time[/i] an object falls under the configured threshold, even outside of the configured maintenance window and they will continue repairing the object completely.

build.title: Build
build.description: Foundations, taxiways, roads, fences, walls, flooring, and more. This is the lifeblood of your airport.

zones.title: Zones
zones.description: Specify which areas are for ticketing, security, offices, retail, and more.

staff.title: Staff
staff.description: The staff are at the center of it all. They will handle the day-to-day operations of your airport.

finance.title: Finance Hub
finance.subheading: Track Your Cash & Get Bank Loans
finance.description: Your one-stop-shop for everything finance related! Review your financial situation, see revenue & expenses information, or to take out a Bank Loan.

research.title: Research
research.description: Allows you to have your administrators to research new objects and tools, improvements to existing tools, and many other beneficial techs.

operations.title: Operations Control Panel
operations.description: Adjust ground transport options, configure your runways, and manage your airport's fuel services.

flight_schedule.title: Flight Management
flight_schedule.description: Flight Contracts are the lifeblood of your airport; it all starts with an accepted contract & it ends with a fine-tuned schedule!

flight_status.title: Flight Status
flight_status.description: See if the flights coming & going are on-time, their boarding rates, and additional detailed flight status data.

scenario_editor.title: Scenario Editor
scenario_editor.description: Setup the scenario, add objectives with rewards, set lose conditions with consequences, and set what is locked and unlocked.

grants.title: Government Grants
grants.subheading: Goals and Payments for Airport Expansion
grants.description: View all available grants provided by the government to support the development of this airport.

floorselector.title: Current Floor
floorselector.description: Which floor you are building on and the highest floor you can see right now.

overlay_SecureAreas.title: Secure Areas
overlay_SecureAreas.description: Visualize your airport's indoor secure areas, and see how your 'Secure Wings' are divided if you have more than one.

overlay_Environment.title: Environment Overlay
overlay_Environment.description: Visualize the effect that foliage, decorations, and insanitary objects have on passengers.

overlay_Information.title: Information Overlay
overlay_Information.description: Visualize the effect that knowledge-emitting objects have on passengers.

overlay_Sectors.title: Sector Display
overlay_Sectors.description: Visualize the 'sectors' of your airport. This report/tool will have additional functionality in the future! =)

overlay_paxAI.title: Pax AI Decisions
overlay_paxAI.description: See what the Pax AI considered doing by enabling this report & then clicking on any passenger! Note: this is a debug tool that we're enabling publicly for now, to see if it can help us (and you) to better hone in on AI/selection bugs, and balance tweaks. Please excuse any rough edges!

overlay_paxflow.title: Pax Flow
overlay_paxflow.description:
Highlights all the passengers in your airport regardless of what floor they are currently on to assist in observing and improving the foot traffic flows throughout your airport.
GREEN | CIRCLE = Departure Pax RED | SQUARE = Arrival Pax CYAN | HEXAGON = Connecting Flight Pax MAGENTA | STAR = Flight Crew YELLOW | TRIANGLE = Airport Staff
<b>Alternate Views - Use TAB to switch.

bank.title: Bank Balance
bank.desc4: Estimate is based on flight schedule for TODAY and ASSUMES no cancellations or delays. Estimate only! See Profit and Loss report for fully accurate historical data.
bank.bankruptHelper: If your bank balance does not become POSITIVE within this time then you will be declared bankrupt and the game will end.

airlines.title: Airline Interest
airlines.desc1: Airline interest is based on price sensitivity, passenger satisfaction, airport facilities, and more. Work hard for access to the best airlines, or face having offers reneged!

weather.title: The SimWeather Channel
weather.warning: All runways are currently inactive due to weather. Consider upgrading your runways to increase maximum allowed crosswind tolerances if you already have both vertical and horizontal runways available.

tt1.title: Confirm Land Purchase
tt1.desc: Are you sure you want to purchase this parcel of land?

tt2.title: IMPORTANT - Save Your Game!
tt2.desc: During land expansion, the game may crash when writing "land_expansion.airport" and reloading. We strongly recommend saving your game before continuing.

vending.tt: Applies the current price settings to all of the {0} objects in your airport.

strings.keyfunc: None FlightSchedule ProfitAndLoss FlightStatus AirlinesMenu FollowMode ZoneToggle CameraPanLeft CameraPanRight CameraPanUp CameraPanDown CameraZoomIn CameraZoomOut GameSpeedPauseToggle GameSpeedNormal GameSpeedFaster GameSpeedFastest RotateObject PlanningToggle OpsControlPanel StaffHub LevelUp LevelDown Goto Ground Floor Dismantle Tool Timelapse Toggle>

ea.title: Coming Soon
ea.desc: This feature is not yet available.

tooltip.ConstructionWarning: One or more workers were recently unable to reach this position.
tooltip.ZoomForDetails: Zoom in for today's flight details.
tooltip.UnassignedToDepot: Not assigned to baggage depot! ({0} candidates)
tooltip.AssignedToCandidateWarning: Warning: One or more assigned {0} are not in the same zone and will not be used.
tooltip.ZoneCapacity: Zone capacity can be increased by enlarging the area of the zone, or using certain 'storage' objects for increasing allowed density.
tooltip.LateDepartureFCWarning: Notice: Waiting for flight crew to board. Check 'Highlight Passengers' to see why.

functionality.ReqZoneRestock: Must be placed within a {0} zone in order to be restocked.
functionality.ReqAssignedGAD: Requires at least one Gate Agent Desk to be assigned.
functionality.ReqDoorReachableFromGAD: Door must be reachable from at least 1 assigned Gate Agent Desk.
functionality.ReqTaxiwayPath: Requires a taxiway path to at least one runway.
functionality.ReqTaxiwayPathArrival: Requires a taxiway path to at least one runway set to accept arrivals.
functionality.ReqTaxiwayPathDeparture: Requires a taxiway path to at least one runway set to accept departures.
functionality.ReqTerminalDoor: Requires a door to the terminal.
functionality.ReqAssignedQueueType: One or more assigned {0} must have a designated queue for {1}.
functionality.ReqSecurityQueueType: {0} don't have a designated queue on any security check stand that leads to this gate.
functionality.ReqSecUsage: Usage positions must be in {0} or non-secure area.
functionality.ReqAssignedGate: Requires an Aircraft Gate to be assigned.
functionality.ReqSecuredBy: Requires being secured by one or more security zones.
functionality.ReqReception: Requires being secured by one or more reception zones.
functionality.ReqRemoteBagScanner: Requires at least 1 Remote Bag Scanner within the same zone to be assigned.
functionality.ReqRemoteStation: Requires Remote Security Station in same zone to be assigned
functionality.ReqFuelNetwork: Not connected to underground fuel pipeline network
functionality.ReqFuelNetworkFuel: Connected to fuel pipeline, but no networked fuel tanks
functionality.ReqFuelNetworkDepot: Connected to fuel pipeline, but no networked Fuel Depot
functionality.ReqAdjacentRoad: Requires an adjacent Road or Taxiway.
functionality.ReqProximityRoad: Must be adjacent to a Road that can reach spawn & despawn points.
functionality.ReqProximityTaxiway: Requires at least one taxiway connected on both ends.
functionality.FuelTankProximityNoSegment: Tank is too far away from road/taxiway to be directly accessible by vehicles.
functionality.FuelTankProximityWithSegment: Tank is too far away from road/taxiway and can only be accessed by vehicles indirectly through other objects on the same underground fuel pipeline.
functionality.ReqLongerRunway: Runway length too short for any aircraft.
functionality.ReqFunctionalHangar: Requires at least one functional Hangar with a Baggage Car.
functionality.ReqToolboxes: Workers can't repair this object right now because no toolboxes are available.
functionality.ReqValidMaintZone: {0} requires repair that cannot be completed. Build a valid Maintenance zone to allow repairs to be conducted.
functionality.ReqAccessible: Must be accessible, directly or via door
functionality.ProximityWall: Blocked by nearby Fence or Wall
functionality.RunwayBusy: Runway is already under construction or in use
functionality.DoorPlacement: Must be placed on existing wall or indoors
functionality.ReqWall: Must be on an existing wall
functionality.SecDividerPlacement: Cannot be placed inside or adjacent to a Security Zone
functionality.RwyUpgradeAlignment: Must be properly aligned with the runway
functionality.RwyUpgradeProximity: Must be closer to the runway
functionality.FaceRoad: Must be placed facing a Taxiway or Road
functionality.LRT: Must be placed on the left side of light rail tracks
functionality.QueueAdd: Must add to the end of 1 queue at a time
functionality.QueueRemove: Must remove from the end of 1 queue at a time
functionality.AssignmentNA: Flight crews don't need a queue here
functionality.Conveyor_h2h: {0} must form a direct connection to exactly 1 other hub
functionality.Conveyor_mat_wrong: The conveyor type is wrong and cannot be connected that way
functionality.ZoneFull: One or more {0} Zones are full
functionality.UnscheduledFlightValidation: One or more accepted flights NOT scheduled yet! Click to schedule them now.
functionality.WorkmenCountValidation: Hire one or more Workman to complete your pending construction projects!
functionality.ReqFoundationAbove: Requires foundation on the floor above
functionality.ReqFoundationBelow: Requires foundation on the floor below
functionality.ReqDemolishAbove: Upper floor must be demolished first
functionality.ReqFloorList: Can't draw on this floor. Requires: {0}
functionality.ReqGateIdle: Requires gate to be idle first
functionality.ZoneAlreadySecure: This should be adjacent to at least one non-secure and non-staff-protected area.

strings.ZoneEnclosedValidation: Requires a fully enclosed space with a door.
strings.ZoneSecureValidation: Must be placed in a non-secure area.

NotableProperties.RequiresNetwork: Requires connection to the utility network
NotableProperties.RequiresSecure: Must be placed in a secure area
NotableProperties.RequiresZone: Must be placed in a {0} Zone
NotableProperties.PlacementProximity: Must be placed within {0} meters of a runway
NotableProperties.PlacementFlush: Must be placed on a runway

None.name: None
None.description: Use this to de-zone an area completely.

Ticketing.name: Ticketing
Ticketing.description:
The ticketing zone is where passengers will go to print out their boarding passes & check any large luggage that they may have.
One checked bag for free?! Not here.

Reception.name: Visitors Reception
Reception.description: Used by visiting Airline Executives to access areas not meant for ordinary passengers. Use this as a barrier, and areas behind it will not be accessible by passengers.

Security.name: Security
Security.description: Security zones allow you to scrutinize your passengers and keep your airport safe and secure which your passengers will appreciate. And occasionally you can even give them a little extra "pat down".

Garbage.name: Garbage
Garbage.description:
Janitors will take all of your airport's garbage here. The garbage truck will also come here to pick up & haul it off.
A larger zone accomodates more garbage, and zone efficiency can be further increased by placing Dumpsters in the zone.

Deliveries.name: Deliveries
Deliveries.description:
This is where your supplies will be delivered to.
Includes all construction supplies, retail inventory, and any other deliveries. Larger zones can store more supplies, and you can use Supply Shelves to further increase the zone efficiency.

Dropoffs.name: Dropoffs
Dropoffs.description: This is where all departing passengers will be dropped off at.

Pickups.name: Pickups
Pickups.description: This is where arriving passengers will go to get picked up so that they can leave your airport (and get on with their vacation!).
Pickups.subheading: Passengers waiting to be picked up.

BaggageClaim.name: Baggage Claim
BaggageClaim.description: An area for passengers to pick up their checked baggage.

Cafe.name: Cafe
Cafe.description: Setup a space for people to purchase food and to sit down and eat. Let them put their money where their mouths are!

Store.name: Store
Store.description: Sell the latest (and most profitable) branded products. Passengers are happier when they're spending their money, and so are you!

Office.name: Office
Office.description: This zone allows your Administrators & Executives to have their own offices. The execs require offices to be able to do their work and conduct research.

Conference_Room.name: Conference Room
Conference_Room.description: Meetings between airline executives and your Administrators take place in these conference rooms. These are vital for improving communication.

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.description: All food served in your kiosks and cafes will need to be prepared & cooked in a kitchen.

Storage.name: Storage
Storage.description: This is where leftover supply boxes will be stored.

Male_Restroom.name: Male Restroom
Male_Restroom.description: Passengers won't be very happy if they don't have easy access to restrooms. You'll use this zone to define the restrooms for your passengers to use.

Female_Restroom.name: Female Restroom
Female_Restroom.description: Passengers won't be very happy if they don't have easy access to restrooms. You'll use this zone to define the restrooms for your passengers to use.

Electrical.name: Electrical
Electrical.description: This is where you'll run many of your airports wires to, including much of your low-voltage and audio wiring.

First_Class_Lounge.name: First Class Lounge
First_Class_Lounge.description: Add a lounge for first class passengers to better accommodate their needs and desires.

Flight_Crew_Lounge.name: Flight Crew Lounge
Flight_Crew_Lounge.description: Add a lounge for flight crews where they can privately relax and wait to catch their flights.

Maintenance.name: Maintenance
Maintenance.description: This is where maintenance supplies will be stored.

Arcade.name: Arcade
Arcade.description: Help with boredom, helps keep your passengers distracted and entertained.

reason.PropertyTaxImprovements: Property Taxes - Land Improvements ({0} improved tiles)
reason.PropertyTaxLand: Property Taxes - Land Value ({0} total tiles)

CloneTool.name: Clone Tool
CloneTool.description: Copy and paste for airports! Can only be used indoors and several object types are restricted from being cloned. Click and drag to 'copy' an area then left-click to place the copied area. Rotate 'clipboard' with rotate key, right-click to reset.

TaxiwayDirection.name: Taxiway Direction Tool
TaxiwayDirection.description: Click on existing taxiways to change its one-way direction setting. Continue clicking to rotate through directions or to remove one-way entirely.

AddQueue.name: Expand Queue
AddQueue.description: Click & drag to create or extend a defined queue that can be assigned to objects to help improve their throughput.

RemoveQueue.name: Shrink Queue
RemoveQueue.description: Click & drag to shorten the end of a queue.

VisualizeQueue.name: Visualize Queues
VisualizeQueue.description: A visualization tool which shows all queues and assignments in your airport -- all at once.

AreaSell.name: Area Sell
AreaSell.description: Draw over the top of Supply Piles in order to sell multiple at once.

AsphaltRunway.name: Asphalt Runway
AsphaltRunway.description: Click & drag to create (or extend an existing) runways. Note extending or intersecting an existing runway requires repainting the entire runway.

ConcreteRunway.name: Concrete Runway
ConcreteRunway.description: Click & drag to create (or extend an existing) runways. Note extending or intersecting an existing runway requires repainting the entire runway.

ClearUtilities.name: Clear Utilities
ClearUtilities.description: Removes baggage conveyors, fuel pipes, and dismantles utility-related objects.

Demolish.name: Demolish
Demolish.description: Removes walls and indoor flooring down to grass.

Fence.description: A chain link wall that can be used to secure areas of your airport.

Foundation.name: Foundation
Foundation.description: Makes an area indoors by paving concrete and surrounding it with walls.

FuelPipe.description: Connect fuel systems together using underground fuel pipes.

Ramp.description: For aesthetic purposes only -- you can use this to surround outdoor gates, hangars, etc. for a more realistic look.

Road.name: Road
Road.description: Route vehicles to where they need to go with 2x2 sections. Use 'R' key to rotate.

Taxiway.name: Taxiway
Taxiway.description: Route aircraft from runways to tarmac areas with large 10x10 sections.

Wall.description: A long lasting concrete wall that's perfect for securing and separating indoor areas of your airport.

Window.description: Keep it fresh & airy for your passengers or give them a view, all while still serving similar purposes as a wall does in dividing up spaces.

MovingWalkway.name: Moving Walkway
MovingWalkway.description: Creates and extends moving walkways which allow passengers to get move around your airport faster and with less effort. Moves in a single direction which can be reversed any time after construction completes.

DemolishUtility.name: Demolish Utility
DemolishUtility.description: Removes underground baggage conveyors & fuel pipelines.

ShowWires.name: Show Wires
ShowWires.description: Show all wired connections for the electronics within your airport. Wires connect much of the low voltage technology together within your airport.

Conveyor.name: Conveyor Network
Conveyor.d0: Connects underground conveyor network for: Ticketing Desks, Hubs, Endpoints, Depots, Carousels
Conveyor.d3: Connect all objects to a hub
Conveyor.d8: Having trouble? Hover over a Depot or Gate for helpful info. In underground view click any underground object & connected objects will change color.

ClearConcrete.name: Bare Concrete
ClearConcrete.description: Removes floor and leaves concrete behind.

Finance.name: Finance
Finance.description: The CFO allows you to conduct additional research and unlock various finance-related utilities such as advanced reports, bank loans, lower taxes, and improved profit margins.

BankLoans.name: Bank Loans
BankLoans.row0: Allows you to obtain bank loans.

Operations.name: Operations
Operations.row0: Ability to hire a COO (Chief Operations Officer).

RoadBuilding.name: Road Building
RoadBuilding.row0: Ability to build and demolish roads.

MultiLaneAccess.name: Multi-Lane Access
MultiLaneAccess.row0: Changes your airport entrance and exit to be 2-lane roads for higher throughput.

UpgradedBuses.name: Upgraded Buses
UpgradedBuses.row0: Schedules an extra double-decker bus every 30 minutes.

Pricing.name: Pricing
Pricing.row0: Affords the ability to change prices for runway and terminal usage.

BankLoans2.name: Bank Loans II
BankLoans2.row0: Allows you to borrow up to $500k at once.

BankInterest.name: Lower Interest Rates I
BankInterest.row0: Drops your interest rate down to 6% on bank loans.

StandbyGates.name: Standby Gates
StandbyGates.description: Standby gates can be used to improve airport operations by reducing the number of canceled or delayed flights.

Lightrail.name: Light Rail Transit
Lightrail.row0: Allows placing a LRT Platform on the map.
Lightrail.description: Light rail reduces traffic congestion by offering passengers a convenient way to arrive and depart from your airport.

LandExpansion.name: Land Expansion
LandExpansion.row0: Allows the purchase of additional map parcels.

Operations2.name: Operations II
Operations2.row0: Allows management of bus, garbage, retail, and light rail services via the Operations Control Panel.

AviationOps.name: Aviation Ops
AviationOps.row0: Allows you to configure runways to accept only Departures or Arrivals.

Technology.name: Technology
Technology.row0: Ability to hire a CTO (Chief Technology Officer).

LongerTrains.name: Longer LRTs
LongerTrains.row0: Upgrades your LRT to a 4-car, 250 max capacity train!

FuelPorts.name: Fuel Ports
FuelPorts.row0: Allows gates to be upgraded with Fuel Ports that can deliver jet fuel right where it's needed!

AdvTicketing.name: Advanced Ticketing
AdvTicketing.row0: Ability to assign Aircraft Gates to specific Ticketing Desks.

AdvSecurity.name: Advanced Security
AdvSecurity.row0: Access to Remote Security Stations & Remote Baggage Scanners for more efficient Security Operations.
AdvSecurity.description: Ability to assign ID Check Stands to Baggage Scanners; and Baggage Scanners to Metal Detectors / Body Scanners -- for precise flow control.

IntersectingRunways.name: Runway Intersections
IntersectingRunways.row0: Allows you to build Intersecting Runways.

BankLoans3.name: Bank Loans III
BankLoans3.row0: Allows you to borrow up to $2M at once.

BankInterest2.name: Lower Interest Rates II
BankInterest2.row0: Drops your interest rate down to 3% on bank loans.

FinanceVP.name: VP of Finance
FinanceVP.row0: Allows you to hire a VP of Finance, who also happens to be a CPA.

LowerPropertyTaxes1.name: Lower Property Tax I
LowerPropertyTaxes1.row0: Drops your daily property taxes by 10% of the normal amount.

LowerPropertyTaxes2.name: Lower Property Tax II
LowerPropertyTaxes2.row0: Drops your daily property taxes by 25% of the normal amount.

LowerIncomeTaxes1.name: Lower Income Tax I
LowerIncomeTaxes1.row0: Drops your daily Income Tax rate to 30%.

LowerIncomeTaxes2.name: Lower Income Tax II
LowerIncomeTaxes2.row0: Drops your daily Income Tax rate to 25%.

Maintenance.name: Maintenance
Maintenance.row0: Allows you to configure all maintenance options, including repair thresholds for different object types.

Escalators.name: Escalators
Escalators.row0: Allows construction of one-way escalators between the floors of your airport.

OneWayTaxiways.name: One-Way Taxiways
OneWayTaxiways.row0: Allows access to the one-way taxiway tool to setup segments of taxiways that are restricted to a single direction.

CreditReporting.name: Credit Reporting
CreditReporting.row0: Allows access to detailed credit reports and provides pre-application interest rate estimates for loans.

BagHubBoosters.name: Bag Hub Boosters
BagHubBoosters.row0: Allows construction of Baggage Hub Boosters for increased sorting throughput on your hubs.

OneWayPaths.name: One-Way Paths
OneWayPaths.row0: Allows construction of 'One-Way Path' objects for fine-grained control over the paths that passengers take within your airport.

staffScheduler.title: Schedule Editor:
staffScheduler.tooltipDescription: Allocate staff to manage objects at different times of the day.
staffScheduler.tooltipDescription2: Allocate staff to manage objects at different times of the day. Save money when they go home!
staffScheduler.DeleteWarning: You must have at least one schedule.
staffScheduler.DeleteConfirmation: Are you sure you wish to delete this schedule?

NewStaffHub.Arriving: The new administrator is travelling to work.
NewStaffHub.FireHover:
This will not fire anyone until you select the green tick.
Hold Shift to remove 5 staff at once! Hold Ctrl to remove 10 staff at once!
NewStaffHub.HireHover:
This will not hire anyone new until you select the green tick.
Hold Shift to add 5 staff at once! Hold Ctrl to add 10 staff at once!
NewStaffHub.DeploymentHover: Hold Shift to add or remove 5 at once! Hold Ctrl to add or remove 10 at once!
NewStaffHub.ConfirmFire: You are about to fire {0} workers!
NewStaffHub.ConfirmFireSingleGrammar: You are about to fire a worker!
NewStaffHub.ConfirmHire: You are about to hire {0} workers!
NewStaffHub.ConfirmHireSingleGrammar: You are about to hire a worker!
NewStaffHub.DailyOverhead: Each scheduled staff has a daily management overhead. They save you money by automatically leaving and arriving based on the schedule set.
NewStaffHub.MissingStaff: You are missing some staff to complete all of the jobs you have scheduled.
NewStaffHub.UnconfirmedChanges: You did not confirm the hiring or firing of staff, are you sure you wish to continue?
NewStaffHub.AutoTooltipHead: Auto Hire and Fire Scheduled Staff
NewStaffHub.AutoTooltipBody:
When you assign more staff to a schedule than you currently have, or assign less and need to get rid of spare, this will automatically hire and fire them.
This will have a 6 second delay after any change, so that it will not be costly if you accidentally over-assign or under-assign in the schedule editor.

NewKitchens.NeedDisplay: Food Cooler OR Food Warmer OR Drink Machine OR Coffee Maker
NewKitchens.Preps: At least 3 Prep Carts are recommended for efficiency!
NewKitchens.Plates: At least 2 Hot Plates are recommended for efficiency!
NewKitchens.KioskNoKitchen: Assign this to a kitchen in order to fulfill orders!
NewKitchens.FoodWarning: You have zero food stock! Meals cannot be prepared.
NewKitchens.StockTip: Deliveries happen at midnight by default.
NewKitchens.CafeChairs: Requires any type of cafe chair or fancy chair.

NewStores.GoodsWarning: You have zero stock of products!
NewStores.CashRegisterWarning: Must be placed in a {0} to sell products or a {1} to sell food!

ScenarioEditor.Title: Scenario Editor
ScenarioEditor.Name: Scenario Name
ScenarioEditor.LoanWarning: Loans are not allowed in this scenario.
ScenarioEditor.RunwayWarning: You cannot earn income from runway usage in this scenario.
ScenarioEditor.TerminalWarning: You cannot earn income from terminal usage in this scenario.
ScenarioEditor.FailedScenario: You failed to complete the scenario.
ScenarioEditor.Bankrupt: You've been insolvent for 2 days now, and your airport has been closed due to bankruptcy.
ScenarioEditor.SelectScenario: Select a save that you will play as a scenario. It needs to have been modified in the Scenario Editor first to have any content in it. Or, check the workshop for saves tagged with Scenario!
ScenarioEditor.SandboxWarning: This is currently a sandbox level, and will be converted to a non-sandbox level automatically.
ScenarioEditor.CantSell: You can't sell the map while in a scenario until it is won.
ScenarioEditor.Locked: This object is locked in this scenario! You might be able to unlock it later.

AirlineDeals.CFO: Can increase the amount the airline is willing to pay in negotiations.
AirlineDeals.COO: Because the COO helps your airport operate smoother, each facility has a greater positive effect on the airline.
AirlineDeals.CTO: Because of the CTO's advanced knowledge, the airline will be more willing to move towards your suggested offers.
AirlineDeals.Foreman: Dealing in health and safety, he can reduce the 'cost' to the airline for negotiating large and extra large flights.
AirlineDeals.FinanceVP: Can increase the amount the airline is willing to pay in negotiations. Just like the CFO, but slightly less effectively.
AirlineDeals.Advice: Once arrived at the airport, Sales Reps and Administrators will appear here. You can hire them from thew Staff Hub.
AirlineDeals.RepWarning1: Assign a Rep with a functioning office to this Airline to negotiate a new deal. The airline also needs to have at least a 40% rating of your airport.
AirlineDeals.RepWarning2: Assign a Rep with a functioning office to this Airline to see its needs.
AirlineDeals.Tutorial1:
Select the number of planes you are looking to negotiate for, set the time block for them to arrive in, and make sure your airport has the right facilities to serve them. Then, call the Airline to begin the talks.
The more they are satisfied with your service, the more flights they will offer and the less demands they will make.
AirlineDeals.Tutorial2:
Use the atmosphere to work out how positively or negatively the airline is reacting to your changes. Use the text input boxes to type in new offers, or use the sliders.
Up to one offer can be made non-negotiable, which will make them stick with that value. However, this may hinder their ability to return you their best offer.
Remember to read the contract breaches section, and checkout the current deal you have with this airline.
AirlineDeals.Intro: Upsell your contracts to airlines by offering facilities in exchange for higher fees. You can also request additional planes here.
AirlineDeals.TimeSlots: Choose the time slot for the flights to arrive in. Each airline has preferences for each, so the higher the score the less it will cost them (and you!)
AirlineDeals.LowInterest: Since the last negotiation took place, we have found the deal is no longer suitable. We need to negotiate or else the contract will be terminated.
AirlineDeals.CannotRenegotiate: Since the last negotiation took place, we have found the deal is no longer suitable. It is not of our interest to renegotiate the contract at this time, so the previously negotiated terms will be terminated.
AirlineDeals.Feedback:
This airline is too small to negotiate with you right now, or they have too low of an interest. They can serve up to {0} planes and have an interest of {1}.
Asking for more planes may open up this airline to you for negotiation.
AirlineDeals.AirlineMatchScheduler: Airline of flight must match the airline of the gate.
AirlineDeals.HoverZoneBody: Click to assign exclusive rights to an airline.
AirlineDeals.ConfirmBody: Any changes you have negotiated will be discarded. This will hurt Communication and lose you a small amount of Trust with this airline.
AirlineDeals.ConfirmWarning: Warning: The airline is demanding a renegotiation! This will breach your existing contract!
AirlineDeals.Waiting: Your counter offer has been sent to the airline. They will get back to you when they have reached a verdict within the next day.
AirlineDeals.Decline: They have declined our offer in the negotiations.
AirlineDeals.Counter: We need to negotiate further on the current deal.
AirlineDeals.RepCostHeader: It will cost {0} to assign each rep.
AirlineDeals.NoContracts: This airline has no flight offers available for you. Work on earning a higher airline interest and check that you have not already negotiated all of their additional flight contracts.
AirlineDeals.DefaultTerms:
The contract will be cancelled if there is a failure to assign any newly negotiated flights to the schedule within 48 hours; or, if a minimum reliability need was negotiated and breached; or, if the Airline wishes to renegotiate and this is denied; finally, if the agreed upon facilities were not added promptly, causing the Airline's facility need to rise.
If the contract is breached, the negotiated penalty will be charged. Additionally, the negotiated runway and terminal fees will be reset to the Commerical Prices set, and the daily fee will be set to zero.
AirlineDeals.ProtectedOffice: This airline-assigned office must not be blocked by a staff door or outdoor gate.
AirlineDeals.ProtectedConference: This conference room must not be blocked by a staff door or outdoor gate.
AirlineDeals.SecureOffice: This airline-assigned office must not be in a secure zone.
AirlineDeals.MeetingTip: Once you have assigned administrators or sales reps to airlines, they will automatically arrange for meetings here!
AirlineDeals.Break: On a break. Will continue shortly.
AirlineDeals.OtherNegotiation: You have another negotiation in progress. You must finish that one first.
AirlineDeals.OfferFacility: To offer this facility to an airline, you first need to negotiate them away. During negotiations, you can earn extra income by assigning exclusivity to airlines.
AirlineDeals.MissingFacilitiesWarning: This airline is missing some negotiated facilities!
AirlineDeals.FacilitiesTip: Go to the Airline Details screen to see what's missing for each airline.
AirlineDeals.ExcellentDeal: You bargained hard and came out with the better deal!
AirlineDeals.FairDeal: Well done. You got a fair deal.
AirlineDeals.PoorDeal: You gave them a good deal! That was generous of you, but it certainly meant you did not come out on top!
AirlineDeals.BadDeal: You got robbed! Coming from the meeting room, you can overhear the laughter from the airline executives.
AirlineDeals.AssignRepCurrentDeal: Assign a Rep with an office to this Airline to start negotiating a new deal.
AirlineDeals.FlightCancelText: Are you sure you want to cancel {0}?
AirlineDeals.CancelNonScheduled: This flight was part of a negotiation and was never scheduled! This will breach and terminate your current deal.
AirlineDeals.CancelTooShort: This flight was part of a negotiation and was accepted only in the past 48 hours! This will breach and terminate your current deal.
AirlineDeals.ExtendedTerms: If your airport has less than {0} flights accepted from this airline, the contract will become breached.
AirlineDeals.CancelTooFewFlights: You must not have less than {0} accepted flights with this airline to continue your custom deal. This will breach the contract.
AirlineDeals.MoreInterest: This airline needs at least 40% interest to negotiate with you.
AirlineDeals.MoreFlights: You must accept at least {0} flights from this airline to negotiate.
AirlineDeals.MoreDays: Your airport must have been open for at least {0} days.
AirlineDeals.RepOffice: You must have an assigned rep with a functioning office to negotiate.
AirlineDeals.PriorityTooltip: Use this bar to set how often the administrator spends researching vs improving the airline's communication need. If they finish all of their research tasks, they will assume 100% airline responsibility automatically.
AirlineDeals.ImmediateCharge: You will be charged immediately if assigning them.
AirlineDeals.TutorialDays: TUTORIAL: Normally, you would have to wait 12 days before opening up negotiations.
AirlineDeals.NotApplicable: This no longer meets the requirements.
AirlineDeals.MaxFlights: You cannot negotiate more than 4 flights at once.
AirlineDeals.CannotModText: You cannot import extra airlines until the scenario is won or while tutorial objectives are not completed.
AirlineDeals.AnotherNegotiationV2: You have another negotiations in progress with {0}. Please finish up their negotiations first.
AirlineDeals.AcceptAll: You are about to accept every flight from this airline!
AirlineDeals.ConferenceTable: Requires at least one Conference Table.

AirlineFeedback.General: This airline does not want to negotiate with you.
AirlineFeedback.LargeFlights: You have selected large flights. Reducing the number of these may make it easier for the airline to deal with your request.
AirlineFeedback.Foreman: Hiring and assigning a Foreman to this airline will help them offer you larger flights at a lower cost to them.

AdminAbilities.CFO: Specifically, the CFO adjusts the figures to make it possible for airlines to accept a deal that's slightly worse for them. Just don't tell anyone this!
AdminAbilities.COO: Specifically, each facility added in the negotiations will be worth more, meaning you can charge higher prices!
AdminAbilities.CTO: Specifically, when some airlines create a counter offer, they try to take into consideration what they believe is important to you based on your current airport setup and your counter offers. This CTO gives extra detail to the airline, so that they can do this even more. For example, if you had 3 spare offices, they would be more likely to ask for offices.
AdminAbilities.Foreman: Specifically, asking for custom flights in the negotiations rather than waiting for them to offer you flights is expensive for them. This will reduce how much Large and Extra Large planes will affect their demands.
AdminAbilities.FinanceVP: Just like the CFO, but slightly less effectively, they adjust the figures to make it possible for airlines to accept a deal that's slightly worse for them. Just don't tell anyone this!
AdminAbilities.AirlineRep: Has no bonus negotiation abilities, but can still improve communication with the airline during the day and automatically run meetings in the conference room like the other admin.

Breaches.Title: Contract Breach
Breaches.FacilitiesLacking: You did not assign the negotiated facilities in time, or a service reliability was breached.
Breaches.FacilitiesFail: You did not assign the negotiated facilities in time.
Breaches.FuelFail: You did not meet the airline's expected fuel satisfaction levels.
Breaches.ReliabilityFail: You did not meet the airline's expected reliability satisfaction levels.
Breaches.TooFewFlights: You had too few flights assigned with this airline to continue the deal.
Breaches.NeverScheduled: You never scheduled some of the negotiated flights.
Breaches.CancelledShortly: You cancelled a negotiated flight too shortly after it was made available.
Breaches.QuitNegotiations: You quit necessary re-negotiations with the airline.
Breaches.ReliabilityWarning: Warning, this airline's service reliability is worse than the negotiated target! You have 12 hours to fix this!
Breaches.FuelWarning: Warning, this airline's fuel satisfaction is worse than the negotiated target! You have 12 hours to fix this!

AirlineOffers.Gates: Only this airline's aircraft will use the assigned gates.
AirlineOffers.ClassLounges: This airline wants exclusivity to some of your lounges. Only their passengers can use them.
AirlineOffers.CrewLounges: This airline wants exclusivity to some of your lounges. Only their aircraft crews can use them.
AirlineOffers.Offices: This airline would like office space dedicated for them. They may send their own executives to use them, who will require facilities to be provided.
AirlineOffers.ConferenceRooms: An exclusive conference room gives an airline guaranteed daily access for meetings.
AirlineOffers.Cafes: An exclusive cafe for this airline's passengers only. They will also take some of the profits.
AirlineOffers.Stores: An exclusive store for this airline's passengers only. They will also take some of the profits.
AirlineOffers.CafeProfitShare: The profits the airline will take from the cafes assigned to them. You must offer them at least one cafe for this offer to have an affect on the atmosphere.
AirlineOffers.StoreProfitShare: The profits the airline will take from the stores assigned to them. You must offer them at least one store for this offer to have an affect on the atmosphere.
AirlineOffers.Ticketing: This airline wants exclusivity to some of your ticketing zones. Only their passengers can use them.
AirlineOffers.Penalty:
If the contract is breached, this is the penalty you will have to pay.
Click on the Breaches tab to read how the contract can be breached.
AirlineOffers.RunwayFee:
This is how much the airline is willing to pay for each of its aircraft to land on your runways.
This will be reset to the Commercial Pricing level if the contract is breached.
AirlineOffers.NegotiatedReliability:
This is how good the airline expects their reliability need to stay above, or else the contract will be breached.
Reliability includes flight delays, cancellations, and missed passengers who never boarded.
AirlineOffers.NegotiatedFuelSatisfaction: This will be satisfied by good fuel prices and very few failures to meet demands.
AirlineOffers.MinPaxFlight: This is what minimum percent of the aircraft's capacity the airline will be forced to load their flights with.
AirlineOffers.TerminalFee:
This is how much the airline is willing to pay for each of its passengers to use your airport.
This will be reset to the Commercial Pricing level if the contract is breached.
AirlineOffers.DailyFee: This is usually a supplement to runway and terminal fees, to cover admin costs and the ownership of facilities. However, large airlines with many planes will prefer to pay a fixed daily rate rather than a per flight rate, so you may see very high daily rates with no runway or terminal fees.

AirlineNeedDescriptions.Communication: Hire sales reps who will communicate via email to the airline from their offices. Email has limited affect on the score. To get this down further, build conference rooms for face-to-face meetings.
AirlineNeedDescriptions.FuelSatisfaction: This covers how fair your fuel prices are and how few failures to deliver fuel there have been.
AirlineNeedDescriptions.PaxSatisfaction: Airline's don't want a bad image being associated with miserable passengers. You shouldn't, either!
AirlineNeedDescriptions.Fees: The impact that runway fees and terminal fees has on this airline's satisfaction.
AirlineNeedDescriptions.Reliability: This covers how many passengers missed their flights, how many flights have been delayed, and how many were cancelled!
AirlineNeedDescriptions.Trust:
You'll need to earn this airline's trust over time.
Whenever you breach a negotiated deal, cancel a flight, or have poor communication, this will hurt your airline's trust.
AirlineNeedDescriptions.Facilities: If you have negotiated any facilities and have NOT provided them, you will certainly see this get worse. If it reaches 0%, your current deal gets axed.
AirlineNeedDescriptions.FacilityQuality: Each negotiated zone has a room score, and this reflects how happy the airline is with those scores.

RoomValues.HoverZoneBody: Click to assign exclusive rights to an airline and to see the room evaluation.

PaxContexts.CarryBag: Has checked bag and is carrying it.
PaxContexts.NotCarryBag: Has checked bag but is not carrying it.

Grants2019.Heading: Government Grants

Interface.CompleteTier: You must complete the previous tiers.
Interface.UnlockNext: Unlocks the next tier for this track.
Interface.CompleteBasic: You must complete the Basic Airport grant to unlock this.
Interface.TooMany: You cannot accept more than two grants at a time.

BAT1.Objective1: Build a functioning ticketing and security zone.
BAT1.Objective2: Build a functioning gate and runway.

BAT2.Objective1: Run the airport for 2 full days.
BAT2.Objective2: Build 2 Ticketing Kiosks and 3 Normal or XL Flight Info Displays.

PAX1.Objective3: Get the pax-environment satisfaction to at least 60%.

PAX2.Objective1: Build a functional Kitchen and Cafe.
PAX2.Objective2: Get the overall pax satisfaction to at least 75%.

PAX3.Objective3: Get the pax-environment satisfaction to at least 80%.

AIR1.Objective1: Assign at least 1 rep each to 3 airlines.
AIR1.Objective3: Build a runway with a wind resistance of 15KT.

AIR2.Objective1: Load 10 planes with a functioning outdoor baggage system.
AIR2.Objective2: Build 2 Large or XL Aircraft Gates.
AIR2.Objective3: Increase the overall airline interest to 70%.

AIR3.Objective1: Serve 10 planes with a functioning fuel system.
AIR3.Objective2: Negotiate and assign 20 offices to airlines.

INV1.Objective1: Accept a new loan to finance construction.
INV1.Objective2: Build an office and assign a CFO to it.

INV4.Objective1: Have an airport at least {0} days old.

Tracks.BasicAirportDescription: This first track of grants will focus on turning this empty land into a basic, functioning airport.
Tracks.BasicAirportNotBlankSlate: This track is already completed because the airport was pre-built.
Tracks.BasicAirportReward: Unlocks the ATC Tower and the main grant tracks.
Tracks.PAXDescription: This airport needs to make happy tourists. A miserable experience will certainly push away potential new tourists to the region.
Tracks.PAXReward: Makes high end store items have double the purchase chance!
Tracks.AIRDescription: A successful airport requires a good relationship with the airlines. This leads to higher prices that can be charged, and more income into the economy.
Tracks.InvestmentsDescription: Show the airport's value to the community by investing in these small, local businesses. They start small, and get larger and riskier. Your capital is at risk.

Grants2019.UnlockTooltip: This object is hidden behind a grant!

Patrols.AddAdvice: Start adding patrols with the plus button!
Patrols.VectorAdvice: Click on the map to start adding patrol coordinates!
Patrols.BoundToggle: Only accept jobs within the patrol
Patrols.BoundTooltip:
If enabled, Janitors only accept jobs within the areas shown as blue. They may still leave the area to complete certain tasks, such as to dispose of trash bags created inside the patrol area.
With it disabled, they will not ignore jobs very close to them, even if they are far away from the next waypoint. They will still attempt to follow the path, but they have more flexibility for finding jobs.
Patrols.MinVectors: You must have a minimum of 2 coordinate points before you can assign any workers.
Patrols.PatrolWarning: At least one of your patrols has an unreachable point!
Patrols.AssignedTooltip: You currently have {0} Janitors scheduled right now and {1} hired in total.
